column4: How do I mount a swap partition on an external harddrive? (Isn't in fstab)
How do I mount a swap partition that insn't on fstab?
swapon /dev/device
thanks
more specificly, as root:   swapon inode     it can be a partition or file.
how do I mount it to take files out of it
wow.  files in swap space ???
maybe we need to redefine swap here
it is swap, i accidentally put stuff in it under windows
</blinks>
:D
sudo fdisk -l  #find out what fs it says is there   or at least what device it is,  and    file -s /dev/device
happyness!
you know what format (filesystem) is there now ?   mount it with something like:  sudo mount -o fmask=000,dmask=000 -t ntfs-3g /dev/device /mnt
as i said, swap
do you question that?
only how you can have files there and expect to retreve them.  but hey, i don't use swap.
i'm with csilk   how did you do this ?
then use that program and retrieve your files
I don't have windows anymore
and if that partition has been mounted as swap space, i highly doubt that you have usable data one it anymore either.
it hasn't been mounted
someone in ##linuxhelp or ##linux might know something about that.   sometimes you find a developer in there
